Pronto per il Prossimo Passo?

Discutiamo l'opportunit√† ‚Ä¢ Pitch deck dettagliato ‚Ä¢ Due diligence tecnica

Richiedi Pitch Deck üìä
  • Art education vertical: $50B+ globally
  • Target demographic: tech-savvy creatives willing to pay premium
    • </ul>

    Serviceable addressable market: $2B+ in art education + blockchain adoption.

    Who are the main competitors?

    +

    Traditional EdTech: Coursera, Udemy, Skillshare (no blockchain integration)

    Art Platforms: Domestika, Proko (no token economy)

    Blockchain Ed: No major player has comprehensive art + blockchain platform

    Our advantage: First mover with complete tech stack, 18+ month head start.

    What's the go-to-market strategy?

    +

    Phase 1: Partner with 10+ art schools for pilot programs

    Phase 2: Launch creator marketplace and invite influencer artists

    Phase 3: Scale through viral token mechanics and referral programs

    Phase 4: Expand to music, design, and other creative verticals

    Is the technology production-ready?

    +

    Yes, 100% production-ready MVP.

    • Django 4.2+ backend with PostgreSQL
    • React 18+ frontend with TypeScript
    • Polygon blockchain integration (testnet proven)
    • Docker containerized, CI/CD pipeline ready
    • Zero technical debt, clean architecture

    18 months of development completed. Ready to scale immediately.

    Why Polygon blockchain?

    +

    Strategic choice for user experience:

    • Low transaction fees (under $0.01)
    • Fast confirmation times (2-3 seconds)
    • Ethereum compatibility and security
    • Strong ecosystem and developer support
    • User-friendly for non-crypto natives

    Multi-chain ready: can expand to other networks as needed.

    How scalable is the architecture?

    +

    Designed for millions of users:

    • Microservices architecture with Django
    • Database optimization and caching layers
    • CDN-ready for global content delivery
    • Auto-scaling infrastructure with Docker
    • Blockchain layer handles transaction volume

    Current setup can handle 100K+ concurrent users with minimal changes.

    What about regulatory compliance?

    +

    Built with compliance in mind:

    • Educational tokens (utility, not securities)
    • GDPR-compliant data handling
    • KYC/AML ready for institutional clients
    • Transparent smart contracts, auditable
    • Legal consultation throughout development

    Why focus on art education specifically?

    +

    Strategic vertical choice:

    • Artists are early adopters of new technology
    • High willingness to pay for quality education
    • Natural fit with NFTs and digital ownership
    • Strong community effects and peer learning
    • Premium pricing sustainable ($100-500+ per course)

    Art education has higher margins and better retention than generic online courses.

    What's the user acquisition strategy?

    +

    Multi-channel acquisition:

    • Institutional partnerships: Art schools and academies
    • Creator program: Invite renowned artists as instructors
    • Token incentives: Reward early adopters and referrals
    • Community building: Discord, social media, art events
    • Content marketing: Art tutorials, blockchain education

    How do you plan to retain users?

    +

    Token economy drives retention:

    • Tokens earned through learning progress
    • Tokens spent on advanced courses and features
    • Peer review system creates community engagement
    • NFT certificates provide lasting value
    • Social features and artist networking

    Target: 70%+ monthly retention rate through gamification and value delivery.

    What are the revenue projections?

    +

    Conservative growth projections:

    • Year 1: $500K ARR, 10K users
    • Year 2: $2.5M ARR, 50K users
    • Year 3: $10M ARR, 200K users

    Based on $50 average revenue per user per year, growing to $100+ with premium features.

    What funding is needed for scale?

    +

    Seed Round: $500K - $1M

    • Team expansion (2-3 developers, 1 marketing)
    • Mainnet deployment and security audits
    • Initial partnership program
    • User acquisition and content creation
    • 12-18 months runway to Series A

    What's the exit strategy?

    +

    Multiple exit opportunities:

    • Strategic acquisition: EdTech giants (Coursera, Adobe, Autodesk)
    • Financial acquisition: Private equity focused on education
    • IPO path: If we reach $50M+ ARR and market leadership
    • Timeline: 5-7 years optimal exit window

    Target valuation: $50-100M+ based on revenue multiples in EdTech sector.

    What are the main risks?

    +

    Identified risks and mitigations:

    • Regulatory changes: Focus on utility tokens, compliance-first approach
    • Competition: First-mover advantage, strong tech moat
    • User adoption: Free tier, gradual blockchain introduction
    • Technical: Proven MVP, experienced team
    • Market timing: Art + blockchain adoption growing rapidly
